group_1.narration: First, we guided our guests into@the Student Council Meeting Room.
Then, the tea party started on schedule.@But just before that...
The head of the Tea Ceremony Club@arrived with an emergency.

group_1.textLeft: Eh!? Broken pipes in the old building!?
Does that mean that... Water leaked into@the rooms?

group_1.textRight: Calm down Miss Nanase, you’re acting kind@of strange.

group_1.textLeft: I’m sorry... I just didn’t want to accept reality.
So, is the club room... Is the Tea Ceremony@Club Room safe?

group_1.textRight: A pipe on the 2nd floor broke and it was right@underneath it...

group_1.textLeft: ...This is a disaster.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, we’re having one of the contractors@repair it soon.
So, Miss Nanase, since the club room can’t@be used...

group_1.textLeft: Ah!

group_1.narration: 【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Arrive (St. Liliana Academy Student Council)―@―Tea Party in the Student@Council Room (New School Building)―
【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Tea Ceremony Demonstration in the Tea Ceremony@Club Room? (Old School Building)―@―Moon-Viewing Celebration in the Tea Ceremony@Club Room? (Old School Building)―

group_1.textLeft: Isn’t the second half of the schedule practically@obliterated?
No no! You're not the one to blame here.

group_1.textCenter: (The schedule has returned to a blank slate...)
(Rather, things have actually gotten worse@thanks to the passage of time.)
(How can I put this? It’s as if...)
(It's as if some great and terrible will of the@universe is at work)
(Which is specifically targeting me and creating@trouble.)
(...Very well. I shall meet this challenge!)
(If I try my best to solve it, maybe the truth will@come out!)

group_1.textLeft: Oh no, it’s all okay.
I’ll figure something out.
I’m usually in charge of handling such issues!
I'll let the Student President know.

group_1.textCenter: Phew... Report to the Student President, done.
(As I expected, I'll have to deal with it.)
(It'll be nearly impossible to find a substitute@for the Tea Club at this point.)
(But at the very least, I have to reserve a room@for our main event, the Moon-Viewing...)
(A Japanese-style room would be best, if@possible.)
(Oh, what about the Flower Arrangement Club@Room?)
(It's a Japanese-style room... And maybe a live@flower arrangement demonstration will make@them happy?)
(But the Flower Arrangement Club Room is also@in the old school building.)
(If it's also flooded, everything will be ruined...)
...Anyways, let’s go to the old school building!

group_1.textLeft: The head of... the Flower Arrangement Club...?
(Once again, I meet the person I need before@arriving at the old building...)

group_1.textRight: What’s wrong? Isn’t today the exchange@meeting with Lilianna?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that’s right.
But some troublesome issues arose.

group_1.textRight: Don't worry, we’ll take care of both.

group_1.textLeft: Are you sure?

group_1.textRight: Showing off our beautiful flowers to Lilianna’s@students...
It’s okay to use our room for tonight’s@Moon-Viewing, too.
We weren’t flooded, so it’s okay to use it.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:301701:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]I'm rescued!
Thanks to you, the schedule has been completed!
I’ll go report this to the Student President.

group_1.narration: 【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Arrive (St. Liliana Academy Student Council)―@―Tea Party in the Student@Council Room (New School Building)―

【Exchange Meeting Schedule】@―Live Flower Show in the Flower Arrangement@Club Room (Old School Building)― [textRed: New!]@―Moon-Viewing in the Flower Arrangement@Club Room (Old School Building)― [textRed: New!]

group_1.textRight: Why are you carrying your school bag around?

group_1.textLeft: Oh... That’s because...
I went straight from the classroom to the gate@to welcome Lilianna’s students.
Then I've been running around without rest...

group_1.textRight: The Student Council must be having a hard@time, too.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I believe it's all due to the Great and@Terrible Will of the Universe...
No, it’s really nothing.
I look forward to working with you later.

group_1.textCenter: Again, the problem was solved before@entering the old school building.
